io.spine.io

Class Files2

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.io.Files2

  • public final class Files2
extends java.lang.Object
    Additional utilities for working with files.

    These utilities are specific to enable Spine working with code files in code generation, project structure analysis, and other tasks that are not covered by well-known file management libraries.

    For more file-related utilities, please see:

    • Files from NIO
    • Paths from NIO2
    • Files from Guava

    • Method Detail

      • ensureFile

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public static boolean ensureFile(java.io.File file)
        Ensures that the given file exists.

        Performs no action if the given file already exists.

        If the given file does not exist, it is created along with its parent directories, if required.

        If the passed File points to the existing directory, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        In case of any I/O issues, the respective exceptions are rethrown as IllegalStateException.

        Parameters:
        file - a file to check
        Returns:
        true if the file did not exist and was successfully created; false if the file already existed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given file is a directory
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - in case of any I/O exceptions

      • ensureFile

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public static boolean ensureFile(java.nio.file.Path pathToFile)
        Ensures that the file represented by the specified Path exists.

        If the file already exists, no action is performed.

        If the file does not exist, it is created along with its parent if required.

        If the specified path represents an existing directory, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

        If any I/O errors occur, an IllegalStateException is thrown.

        Parameters:
        pathToFile - the path to the file to check
        Returns:
        true if and only if the file represented by the specified path did not exist and was successfully created
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given path represents a directory
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if any I/O errors occur

      • existsNonEmpty

        public static boolean existsNonEmpty(java.io.File file)
        Verifies if a passed file exists and has non-zero size.

      • checkExists

        @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public static java.io.File checkExists(java.io.File file)
        Ensures that the passed file exists.
        Returns:
        the passed file if it exists
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the file is missing

      • copyDir

        public static void copyDir(java.nio.file.Path dir,
                           java.nio.file.Path target)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Copies a whole directory and its contents into another directory.

        Both paths must point to an existing directory.

        The dir itself is copied as well. For example, if the dir path is /my/path/to/folder/foo and the target path is /my/other/folder, as a result of this operation, a /my/other/folder/foo directory will be created and all the contents of the original dir, including nested directories, will be copied there.

        Parameters:
        dir - the dir to copy
        target - the new parent directory
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
